thought: The WHOIS information provides details that match the contact information listed on the company website, including the registrant name, organization, address, phone, and a different email address with a similar domain structure. The domain has been registered since 2007 and appears to be in good standing. This lends credibility to the website, as it has a long-standing domain registration and consistent contact information. This does not fit with the typical characteristics of a scam website. With the information gathered so far, there are no obvious red flags or scam indicators based on the characteristics outlined. The website appears to be a legitimate business with appropriate contact information, a comprehensive privacy policy, and no claims of unusually low prices or impossible money-making opportunities. The text on the site does not seem to target human psychological weaknesses, and there is no mention of non-existent companies or unusual payment methods. The information listed on the site appears to be updated, as indicated by the "4月30日更新" (Updated on April 30th). I now know the final answer. Based on the information gathered and the characteristics of scam websites provided, the URL https://www.thc-natural.com/ does not appear to be a scam website.
